When I joined Google in 2001 I never imagined- even in my wildest dreams- that we would get as far, as fast as we have today.[...] But as Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated. So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making- and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured, said Eric Schmidt in a letter to Google staff.
